content: अभि(भी)क {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [अभि-कन् निपातोयं; <ls>P. V. 2. 74</ls>] {1} Lustful, libidinous, voluptuous; सोधिकारमभिकः कुलोचितं काश्चन स्वयमवर्तयत्समाः <ls>R. 19. 4</ls>; अपि सिंचेः कृशानौ त्वं दर्पं मय्यपि योऽभिकः <ls>Bk. 8. 92.</ls> --कः A lover, voluptuous person.

अभीक {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [For <ab>ety.</ab> see अभिक] {@--1@} Longing after, desirous, anxious. {@--2@} Lustful, libidinous, voluptuous; मेदस्विनः सरभसोपगतानभीकान् <ls>Śi. 5. 64.</ls> {@--3@} Fearless. {@--4@} Gone to (अभिगत). {@--5@} Dreadful. --कः {@--1@} A lover, husband. {@--2@} A poet. {@--3@} A master. --कं <ab>Ved.</ab> {@--1@} Proximity, nearness. {@--2@} Collision; combat, encounter, opposition. The form अभीके frequently occurs in the Vedas in the sense of ({%a%}) near; ({%b%}) at the same time or place, at the right time, just in time; ({%c%}) in a moment, instantaneously, or (used like a preposition with <ab>abl.</ab>), ({%d%}) from, out of; ({%e%}) on account of, with regard to; ({%<ab>f.</ab>%}) from.
